title: Rust port: sync main + port post-split TS features
description:
Goal: Bring rust-port branch up-to-date with main (resolve merge conflicts) and port key TS features added after the branch split into the Rust implementation for parity.

Scope (from main commits since merge-base 60213e3):
- Outbound Telegram API throttling + 429 retry fallback
- Startup auto-load from .last-save-id (oh-my-claude:load) + restart-context messaging
- Context-limit warning should use cumulative context tokens (input+output)
- Per-chat sequentialization semantics (commands/interrupt bypass)
- (Optional) real-time steering parity investigation for CLI backend

Acceptance:
- rust-port merges cleanly with main
- Rust bot behavior matches TS for the above items (where feasible)
- cargo fmt/test/clippy pass; bun typecheck passes (for TS side)
- Changes pushed to origin/rust-port and PR updated
close_reason: Completed rust-port sync + post-split feature parity: merged main, added Telegram API throttling+429 retry, startup auto-load (.last-save-id) + restart-context messaging, cumulative context-limit warning + auto-save, verified per-chat sequentialization/interrupt bypass, and documented steering limitation. All changes pushed to origin/rust-port and PR updated.

title: Merge main into rust-port and resolve conflicts

Acceptance:

- No merge conflicts remain; working tree clean

title: Port outbound Telegram API throttling + 429 retry to Rust
description:
Port TS outbound Telegram API throttling (apiThrottler + 429 retry fallback) to Rust teloxide stack.

Approach:
- Add a MessagingPort decorator or TelegramMessenger wrapper that rate-limits send/edit/delete/reaction calls globally + per-chat.
- Add 429 retry/backoff behavior where possible (parse retry_after if available).

Acceptance:
- Burst sends/edits no longer cause 429 in normal usage
- On 429, operations are retried after server-provided delay
- Unit tests for throttler timing/backpressure OR integration test behind feature flag
- cargo fmt/test/clippy pass

title: Port startup auto-load (.last-save-id) + restart-context messaging to Rust
description:
Port TS startup behavior (src/index.ts):
- If /.last-save-id exists: validate save_id, run oh-my-claude:load, validate 'Loaded Context:' in response, mark restored cooldown, delete .last-save-id after success, notify user.
- Else: scan docs/tasks/save/restart-context-*.md and include latest content in startup prompt.
- Send a startup summary message (startup type: SIGTERM restart / resumed / fresh) to allowed user.

Acceptance:
- Rust bot auto-loads context after restart when .last-save-id present
- Invalid save id is rejected and file removed
- Startup message includes correct type label + optional saved context
- cargo fmt/test/clippy pass
close_reason: Implemented startup notification: .last-save-id auto-load with validation + restart-context detection. Added restored cooldown tracking + unit tests. Pushed commits df8dd1c and 5d26c6d.

title: Port context-limit warning/token reporting parity to Rust
description:
Port TS cumulative context tracking semantics to Rust:
- Track cumulative (input+output) context tokens across turns
- Expose getter for current context tokens and trigger save threshold warning (e.g. 180k/200k) once per session with cooldown after /load
- Ensure any user-facing 'Context Limit Approaching' messages use cumulative tokens (not per-turn)

Acceptance:
- Rust session stats show cumulative token usage
- Save threshold triggers once and respects cooldown
- Any warnings/reporting reflect cumulative tokens
close_reason: Implemented Rust context-limit monitoring using cumulative tokens, warning at 180k, and auto-save via oh-my-claude:save. Persists verified save id to .last-save-id and avoids repeated saves when file already exists. Added parsing tests. Pushed commit 6e59c32.

title: Port per-chat sequentialization + interrupt bypass to Rust
description:
Port TS sequentialize() behavior to Rust teloxide:
- Non-command messages are processed sequentially per chat to avoid race conditions
- Commands and '! interrupt' bypass the queue so they execute immediately

Rust already has ChatLocks in ctb-telegram/router.rs but it's unused; wire it into message handling.

Acceptance:
- Two messages in same chat are processed sequentially
- /commands and !messages bypass the lock
- No deadlocks; concurrency safe
close_reason: Already implemented: per-chat lock acquisition in rust/crates/ctb-telegram/src/handlers/mod.rs (locks normal text/photo/doc/voice per chat; /commands + !interrupt bypass).

title: Investigate real-time steering feasibility in Rust CLI backend
description:
TS supports real-time steering by buffering user messages and injecting them via Agent SDK PreToolUse hook. Rust port currently uses Claude CLI stream-json; may not support mid-run injection.

Work:
- Research claude CLI capabilities for mid-run steering or tool hooks
- If feasible, implement equivalent; else implement best-effort behavior + document limitation

Acceptance:
- Clear decision + recommended implementation path
- If implemented, steering messages sent during execution influence the run (or next safe boundary) without being lost
close_reason: Investigated real-time steering: TS uses Agent SDK PreToolUse hooks to inject systemMessage mid-run; Rust backend uses claude CLI stream-json (one-way stdout) and cannot inject mid-run messages. Documented as known parity gap in docs/rust-port/parity-checklist.md and docs/rust-port/claude-cli-stream-json.md. Pushed commit a391e48.

title: Hook handling in Rust

title: Heartbeat + auto-restart on crash
description: Add ping/pong heartbeat: Node responds to {type:ping} with {type:pong}. Rust sends ping if idle >30s. Timeout on pong -> mark process as dead. When process dies: detect via try_wait() or heartbeat timeout, log stderr tail, spawn new process on next request. Acceptance: Hung/crashed process detected, logged, next request succeeds

Added ctb-telegram router with AppState + per-chat ChatLocks to sequentialize non-command/non-! messages; callbacks bypass queue. notes:

Added retry-on-crash (detect exited with status/code) with session.kill() and a warning reply. Cancellation errors suppress Query stopped when interrupted (consume_interrupt_flag). Added audit logging for TEXT, rate-limit, and errors. Routing updated to bypass per-chat queue for ! messages and sequentialize normal text per chat.

title: Unbounded queue growth in cron scheduler

Impact: Memory exhaustion if bot busy for extended period

title: Bug: '! interrupt' swallowed by steering buffer (text handler)
description:
Regression: In src/handlers/text.ts, steering buffering runs immediately after checkInterrupt(). If user sends an interrupt message starting with '!' while a query is still running, checkInterrupt() aborts the current run but session.isProcessing often remains true, so the stripped interrupt message is buffered as steering and handleText returns early. The previous requests stopProcessing() cleanup then clears the unconsumed steering buffer, so the interrupt instruction never executes.

Fix: Detect interrupt before stripping (or have checkInterrupt return a flag) and skip steering-buffer path for interrupt messages; optionally wait briefly for processing cleanup after interrupt.

title: Critical: Shell injection in save-and-restart.sh
description:
Security: Shell injection vulnerability in save-and-restart.sh

Location: save-and-restart.sh:16-25

Issue: MESSAGE variable injected into heredoc without sanitization
Attack: Message containing EOF or shell metacharacters can break out and execute arbitrary commands

Example attack:
./save-and-restart.sh 'EOF
$(rm -rf ~)
cat <<EOF'

Fix: Use quoted heredoc ('EOF') or printf instead of interpolation

title: Bug: done footer can overwrite final reply (stale lastContent)
description:
Regression: In src/handlers/streaming.ts, the done handler appends elapsed time by editing the last bot message with lastContent + timeFooter. But segment_end edits/creates the final segment without updating state.lastContent, so done can overwrite/truncate the final reply by reverting to stale lastContent (or skip footer when lastContent missing).

Fix: Update state.lastContent whenever segment_end sends/edits/splits, or build footer from the same final formatted value.

Files:
- src/handlers/streaming.ts

Fix: Capture message reference at start of timer callback and verify hasn't changed
